availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
22
The Governor approved an account of $141 25/100 to A. G Hodges & Co for the publication ofthe official vote of Kentucky for the office of President and Vice President
He appointed John Henry a Justice of the Peace for Spencer County in Distric No one in place of Nathan Beauchamp resigned
He appointed Robt W. Winn Notary Public for the county of Clarke until the end of the next session of the General Assembly
He remitted to W. F. Dickey & others $1000 of a Judgment of $1500 by the Henderson Circuit Court and respited the balance of $500 for twelve months, said Judgment was upon a forfeited recognizance
He respited for Six months a judgment of the Danville Police Court of $20. against Wm Griffin for retailing liquors
He remitted to J. Saltmarsh & others a judgment of $50 each by the city Court of Louisville upon a forfeited bail bond

Decr 22d
The Governor respited for twelve months the following judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Casey Cir. Ct. vs. Wm Douglass --
Monroe E. & C. " " E. W. Huggins
Carroll Cir. Ct vs. A. T. Shea

body.p: He commissioned the Adjutant Quarter-Master, Paymaster and Surgeon of the Enrolled Militia for the county of Monroe,
Also the Colonel and Lieutenant Colonel of the Enrolled Militia for Breathitt county and for the county of Webster
He also Commissioned D. W. Lindsey Captain, Geo. B. Bumley 1st Lieut. Olando Brown 2d Lieutenant and Chas M Hawkins 3d Lieutenant of the Governor Guards
And E T. Woolfork 2d Lieutenant of the Paducah City Guards.
